content.description: Triceratops is some very fun climbing on unusual features. A few tricky moves at the bottom but then eases off to easier climbing. Follow the bolt line straight up and top out on a set a chain anchors. This is easily top rope from above. Bolts are 5 to 6 feet apart.

This route lives up to its name as it has its own anchors not accessible from the top. It is isolated. The rock is solid in the climbing is good bolts every 5 to 6 feet. Climb Straight off the bolt line to chain anchors below the overhang.

This route begins at the furthest south end of the Cretaceous Craig. Climb up the bolt line to the top Clipping bolts every 5 to 7 feet. Anchors at the top. A 40 m rope is adequate for this but no shorter. Some loose rock but this is cleaning up as more Climb it.  Always belay uphill from the bolt line so if any loose rock does come off you’re not in the drop zone.
content.location: Drive to Dry Canyon parking area from their walk up the canyon passing the  crag on your left and passing a gully leading up to cretaceous Crag. Continue up canyon another 30 m. As soon as you come to the oak brush on left  look to your left a trail begins climbs up through some scree cutting back left through the oak to the base of Cretaceous crag. Please stay out of the gully  as traffic through this would only cause erosion.

content.description: This route was done back in 2013. To keep in tradition of the Lowe route it was the hardest on the wall at the time. No longer the case. climb past a few hard initial moves than it eases off climb up to the past the last bolt where you’ll see a set of chain anchors that are accessible from the top.

Just up wall from pterodactyl is indecision. Climb straight up following the bolts to the top where chain anchors are located. The crux is past the second bolt but it’s not strenuous. Just like all the routes in this particular area be aware that loose rock is a possibility This will improve as people climb. Belay from the up wall from the route. This keeps you out of the drop zone of any loose rock. Bolts are 5 feet apart.

Just to the right of shuttered room top rope route is T-Rex. The crux is using some side pulls to get past the second and third bolts. Climbing is good,  rock is solid. Anchors at the top which are accessible from the top can be used for a top rope for shuttered room or TRex
This is top rope from the top of T Rex . Bolts may be added later.
content.protection: Top rope for now  no bolts yet

content.description: This is the last climbable line to the north of this crag. If you Boulder moves off the deck and easy climbing above to set anchors at the top that are easily accessible by walking around on to the top.
The climb was done years ago but named recently.  Follow the bolt line  to Chain anchor  at the top.   Good climbing on decent rock.

Around the corner on the west face of Creteceous you will find a nice face that begins with a broken crack then heading up a some fun features to the top. Bolts are 6 feet apart and easily accessed. The crux is past the 4th bolt. Begin at the belay platform and climb up to the first 2 bolts. There you work left using crack and a series of side pulls to clip the 3 bolt then move right and up to some two chain anchors you cannot see from the bottom In any new area be aware that loose rock can and will pose a hazard so stay out of the drop zone. in the beginning there was a lot of loose rock removed for the next guy.   Do your part if you see loose rocks clear them off without hitting your belayer. This will clean up nicely over time. lots of fun moves with pseudo exposure.
